alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:22AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Hancock, southeastern Van Buren, southwestern Lee, Clark and Scotland Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 120 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of Queen City to near Ewing. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and half inch hail in the stronger storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Some Locations impacted include... Kahoka, West Point, Keokuk, Augusta and Bowen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
